data.title: The Youngest Golden Globe Winners & Nominees Of All-Time
data.meta_description: Golden Globes: The Youngest Winners & Nominees Of All-Time
data.text:
These stars were acknowledged for their talents at a very young age by the Hollywood Foreign Press.

He won the Golden Globe in 1980 for New Star of the Year in a Motion Picture – Male at just 9 years old for 'The Champ'. The category no longer exists, but his win will last forever.

She is both the youngest winner and nominee of the Best Actress in a Supporting Role category. She took home the Golden Globe for the movie Paper Moon at 10 years old during the 1974 show.

To this day, she is the youngest person to be nominated in the Best Actress in a Leading Role category for her role in Beasts of the Southern Wild when she was 9.

The now A-List star was just 15 when she won in the category of Best Performance by an Actress in a Television Series – Drama for My So-Called Life.

No one was more shocked than the Glee star who was only 20 years old when he earned the award for Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series for his role as Kurt.

At just 21, she earned a nomination for her role in Netflix’s series '13 Reasons Why' in the Best Performance by an Actress in a Television Series in 2018.

He made a name for himself at 22, when he was nominated for the Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama award for Call Me by Your Name in 2018.
